name: Grand Canyon
info: The Grand Canyon is one of the 7 wonders of the world, being 277 miles long and miles high from the bottom of the canyon with mind blowing rocks to see! The Grand Canyon is one of those things you have to see once in a lifetime with Arizona residents having it next door!

name: Hoover Dam
address: 118 Kingman Wash Access Rd, Temple Bar Marina, AZ 86443
info: Hoover Dam is a concrete arch-gravity dam in the Black Canyon of the Colorado River, on the border between the U.S. states of Nevada and Arizona. It was constructed between 1931 and 1936. It contains 4,400,000 cubic yards of concrete. Four reinforced-concrete intake towers located above the dam divert water from the reservoir into huge steel pipes called penstocks.

name: Glen Canyon National Recreation Area
info: Stretching from the beginning of the Grand Canyon at Lees Ferry in Arizona to the Orange Cliffs of southern Utah, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area is an  location for water-based and backcountry recreation. the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area covers 1,254,429 acres of mostly rugged high desert terrain.

name: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument
info: Among these ruins is the Casa Grande, or Big House, one of the largest and most mysterious prehistoric structures ever built in North America. These sandy buildings have very many stories and legends from them to be explored.

name: Horseshoe Bend
info: a horseshoe-shaped incised meander of the Colorado River, located in the town of Page, Arizona. The hike is about . 6 miles one-way to the overlook. The overlook is about a 1,000' drop, looking down onto the Colorado River.

name: Tonto National Monument
info: Tonto National Monument is a National Monument in the Superstition Mountains, in Gila County of central Arizona. The area lies on the northeastern edge of the Sonoran Desert region, with annual rainfall of about 16 inches

name: Havasu Falls
info: Havasu Falls is the most famous of the Havasupai waterfalls. However, it is not the first you reach when hiking into the Canyon. It is actually the third waterfall during the hiking journey to Havasupai.

name: Lake Mead Recreational Area
info: America's First National Recreation Area. landscapes and brilliant blue waters, this year-round playground spreads across 1.5 million acres of mountains, canyons, valleys and two vast lakes.

name: Taliesin West
address: 12621 N Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd, Scottsdale, AZ 85259
info: Taliesin West is in Scottsdale, Arizona. This monument is a building with amazing history and stories around this monument. Visit to explore Taliesin West and everything behind it.

name: Walnut Canyon National Monument
info: Walnut Canyon National Monument preserves these cliffside homes, which tell the story of the Ancestral Puebloans of Flagstaff and their influence on Hopi culture today.

name: Montezuma Castle National Monument
address: Montezuma Castle Rd, Camp Verde, AZ
info: Montezuma Castle is the third National Monument dedicated to preserving Native American culture. apartment, nestled into a towering limestone cliff, tells a story of ingenuity, survival and ultimately, prosperity in an unforgiving desert landscape.

name: Antelope Canyon
info: Navajo Upper Antelope Canyon is a slot canyon in the American Southwest, on Navajo land east of Lechee, Arizona. It includes five separate, scenic slot canyon sections to explore at Antelope Canyon.
